perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Effective Date' to 'Start Date' while still referencing 'Effective Date' later creates ambiguity about when the agreement actually begins, leading to potential disputes over the term's length. The 'Term' is defined relative to 'Launch', but the initial start is now unclear.

perturbation.original_text:
“Subscriber” means any individual who purchases mobile content programming and: (a) who actually pays the applicable Subscription Fee; and (b) does not
receive a refund of such Subscription Fee for any reason within thirty (30) days from the end of the payment period for which the Subscription Fee was paid. A
Subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement so long as such individual continues to pay the applicable Subscription Fee.
perturbation.changed_text:
“Subscriber” means any individual who purchases mobile content programming and: (a) who actually pays the applicable Subscription Fee; and (b) does not
receive a refund of such Subscription Fee for any reason within thirty (30) days from the end of the payment period for which the Subscription Fee was paid. A
Client remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement so long as such individual continues to pay the applicable Subscription Fee.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Subscriber' with 'Client' in the last sentence creates confusion about the defined term. While a 'Subscriber' is clearly defined, it's uncertain whether a 'Client' who pays the subscription fee is also considered a 'Subscriber' under the agreement, especially since 'Client' is not defined anywhere.

perturbation.original_text:
The IMNTV Programming will not contain any advertising, either integrated or before or after each clip, except IMNTV I’Ds and IMNTV commercials for
solicitation of Chinese music videos,without the prior written approval of both parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
The IMNTV Programming will not contain any advertising, either integrated or before or after each clip, except IMNTV I’Ds and IMNTV advertisements for
solicitation of Chinese music videos,without the prior written approval of both parties.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'commercials' with 'advertisements' is an example of using different terminology for the same concept without defining if they have different meanings. It is unclear whether 'commercials' and 'advertisements' are distinct concepts within the context of this agreement, potentially leading to disputes about the types of promotional content permitted.
